VI.ii.3.C.1.a
.
Training Is Completed During a Prior Year
Scenario
:
In January 2016, a Veteran with a 10-percent disability rating returns a signed
VA Form 21-8951, Notice of Waiver of VA Compensation or Pension to Receive Military Pay and Allowances
, showing 63 days of training attendance during fiscal year 2015.
The regional office (RO) that received the
VA Form 21-8951
processes it in April 2016.
The monthly rate of compensation payable to the Veteran on the last day of fiscal year 2015 (September 30, 2015) was $133.17.
The monthly rate of compensation payable to the Veteran on October 1, 2015, is still $133.17.
Results
:
The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) begins withholding all of the Veteran’s compensation effective October 1, 2015.
VA resumes monthly payments of $133.17 effective December 4, 2015.
Note
:  There was no cost-of-living adjustment (COLA) on December 1, 2015.  Had there been, the Veteran would have been entitled to
the amount of the COLA, for the period December 1, 2015, through December 3, 2015, and
$133.17
plus
the amount of the COLA, effective December 4, 2015.
